description: Lists the handshakes that are associated with the organization that the requesting user is part of. The ListHandshakesForOrganization operation returns a list of handshake structures. Each structure contains details and status about a handshake. Handshakes that are ACCEPTED, DECLINED, CANCELED, or EXPIRED appear in the results of this API for only 30 days after changing to that state. After that, they're deleted and no longer accessible. This operation can be called only from the organization's management account or by a member account that is a delegated administrator.

parameters.name: Filter
parameters.description: A filter of the handshakes that you want included in the response. The default is all types. Use the ActionType element to limit the output to only a specified type, such as INVITE, ENABLE-ALL-FEATURES, or APPROVE-ALL-FEATURES. Alternatively, for the ENABLE-ALL-FEATURES handshake that generates a separate child handshake for each member account, you can specify the ParentHandshakeId to see only the handshakes that were generated by that parent request. ActionType (string) --- Specifies the type of handshake action. If you specify ActionType, you cannot also specify ParentHandshakeId. ParentHandshakeId (string) --- Specifies the parent handshake. Only used for handshake types that are a child of another type. If you specify ParentHandshakeId, you cannot also specify ActionType. The regex pattern for handshake ID string requires 'h-' followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.

nested_params.name: ActionType
nested_params.description: Specifies the type of handshake action. If you specify ActionType, you cannot also specify ParentHandshakeId.

nested_params.name: ParentHandshakeId
nested_params.description: Specifies the parent handshake. Only used for handshake types that are a child of another type. If you specify ParentHandshakeId, you cannot also specify ActionType. The regex pattern for handshake ID string requires 'h-' followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.

nested_items.name: Handshakes
nested_items.description: A list of  Handshake objects with details about each of the handshakes that are associated with an organization.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The unique identifier (ID) of a handshake. The originating account creates the ID when it initiates the handshake.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a handshake.

nested_items.name: Parties
nested_items.description: Information about the two accounts that are participating in the handshake.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The unique identifier (ID) for the party.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The type of party.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The current state of the handshake. Use the state to trace the flow of the handshake through the process from its creation to its acceptance. The meaning of each of the valid values is as follows:

nested_items.name: REQUESTED
nested_items.type: applicable to only some handshake types

nested_items.name: OPEN
nested_items.type: applicable to only some policy types

nested_items.name: RequestedTimestamp
nested_items.description: The date and time that the handshake request was made.

nested_items.name: ExpirationTimestamp
nested_items.description: The date and time that the handshake expires. If the recipient of the handshake request fails to respond before the specified date and time, the handshake becomes inactive and is no longer valid.

nested_items.name: Action
nested_items.description: The type of handshake, indicating what action occurs when the recipient accepts the handshake. The following handshake types are supported:

nested_items.name: Resources
nested_items.description: Additional information that is needed to process the handshake.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The information that is passed to the other party in the handshake. The format of the value string must match the requirements of the specified type.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The type of information being passed, specifying how the value is to be interpreted by the other party:
ACCOUNT - Specifies an Amazon Web Services account ID number.
ORGANIZATION - Specifies an organization ID number.
EMAIL - Specifies the email address that is associated with the account that receives the handshake.
OWNER_EMAIL - Specifies the email address associated with the management account. Included as information about an organization.
OWNER_NAME - Specifies the name associated with the management account. Included as information about an organization.
NOTES - Additional text provided by the handshake initiator and intended for the recipient to read.

nested_items.name: Resources
nested_items.description: When needed, contains an additional array of HandshakeResource objects.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: If present, indicates that more output is available than is included in the current response. Use this value in the NextToken request parameter in a subsequent call to the operation to get the next part of the output. You should repeat this until the NextToken response element comes back as null.
